issues.description: Constructor parameter order for Meal is inconsistent between the problem statement/UML and the template. The problem statement (and the solution) expect a constructor Meal(String name, String[] ingredients) but the template defines Meal(String[] ingredients, String name). This also conflicts with the example usage in the template's Main (which uses Meal("cowBoyStew", new String[]{...})). As a result students following the specification or using the provided Main example will get compilation errors or be confused about the correct constructor signature.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the constructor in the template Meal class to match the specification: declare public Meal(String name, String[] ingredients) and assign fields accordingly (this.name = name; this.ingredients = ingredients). This will align the template with the UML/problem statement and the solution, and will be consistent with the example usage in Main.

issues.description: Constructor parameter mismatch for the Meal class: The problem statement (and the solution) document Meal(String, String[]) — i.e., the first parameter is the meal name and the second is the ingredients array — and the example Main uses that ordering. However, the template implementation declares the constructor as Meal(String[] ingredients, String name) (parameters swapped). This inconsistency breaks the direct mapping between the problem description / example code and the starter code, can cause compile-time confusion or errors for students following the example, and forces them to resolve an incidental API mismatch instead of focusing on the exercise goals.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the template Meal constructor to match the problem statement and solution: declare it as public Meal(String name, String[] ingredients) and assign fields accordingly (this.name = name; this.ingredients = ingredients). Alternatively, update the problem/example to match the template, but the least disruptive fix is to modify the template constructor signature to (String name, String[] ingredients) so the API, examples, and solution align.
